intro: Myosotis sajanensis var. austrobaicalensis, commonly known as the Sajansky Forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Siberia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit, often forming dense clusters. Its botanical significance lies in its unique distribution and adaptation to high-altitude environments.
